subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to write tests that delete ONLY the data they create?
msgSnippet: There is no simple, general answer to this question. Some ideas that come to mind... In the order which I would try first. Maybe you can address the problem on

Subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to write tests that delete ONLY the data
 they create?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=199072473; y=qJ8-qaXyhpVFervMqtqutOvXqQNwIgwF_b9g6lMMw_kE6VbkcNdZGAD2Ox4F

From: Malte Finsterwalder <malte@...>


--089e0122f2be21ba52053c60971f
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

There is no simple, general answer to this question. Some ideas that come
t=
o mind... In the order which I would try first.
Maybe you can address the p=
roblem on the infrastracture-level, as Lothar
suggested. (Copy the DB etc.)=

Mechanisms like Docker-Container might help here, too!
You might be able t=
o execute your tests in a transaction, which is then
rolled back at the end=
 of the test.
You may be able to just add testdata to the DB and don't worr=
y about it,
since it does not harm other tests.
You may be able to separate=
 all new testdata from the data that is present,
so that you can remove it =
safely (i.e. IDs in certain ranges etc.)
And if all else fails, I also reac=
ted a mechanism in a project before, that
remembered all the test data crea=
ted during a test and removed it
individually in a teardown, but that's a l=
ot of work and rather fragile.
Not really recommended.

Greetings,
   Malte=


On 12 September 2016 at 17:59, lowell108@... [junit] <
junit@yahoog=
roups.com> wrote:

>
>
> I'd like to be able to run some tests against full=
y populated QA
> databases. I can't find the right combination of set-up an=
d tear-down to
> erase ALL the data created and inserted in the course of t=
he test but not
> delete other data that preexists in the Db.
>
>
> Can thi=
s be done?
>
>
> 
>

--089e0122f2be21ba52053c60971f
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

<div>





<br><br>




<p><span>I'd =
like to be able to run some tests against fully populated QA databases. I c=
an't find the right combination of set-up and tear-down to erase ALL th=
e data created and inserted in the course of the test but not delete other =
data that preexists in the Db.=C2=A0</span></p><p><span><br></span></p><p><=
span>Can this be done?</span></p>





<br>


<br>

le=3D"color:white;clear:both"></div>
